moves.2. d4 d5 3. Nc3: Supports the center but blocks the c P
moves.3... Nf6 4. e5 Nfd7 5. f4: 5 Nf3 locks in the important f P.
moves.8. Bd3 b5 9. a3: Stopping ...b4 for at least few moves
moves.9... f6 10. exf6: If W play any other move Blk might move f6 - f5 blocking the k side
moves.10... Nxf6 11. Ne5 Qc7 12. O-O: The K R may go to f3 - h3 later
moves.12... O-O 13. Qe1 a5 14. Nb1: N was not doing much on c3
moves.17... c5 18. Nf3 c4 19. Be2 a4: Black has achieved what he wanted when he played the 8th move. That is, far advancing of the Q side pawns.
moves.20. Ng5: W pieces getting closer to the K
moves.20... h5 21. Ne5 Bxe5 22. fxe5 Bd7 23. B: Destroying the K side. g4 is also very useful.
Blk resigned.
He didn't let me mate.
